summary: Otters are carnivorous mammals belonging to the Lutrinae family, which includes 13 species. They live in water or near it and are related to weasels and badgers. Otters live in groups and have unique names for males, females, and babies. They are social and playful, often seen sliding into water and playing with stones. Otters eat fish, frogs, and shellfish, and can live up to 16 years. Humans have interacted with otters in various ways, from hunting them for fur to using them in fishing. Otters are also important in many cultures' stories and myths.
title: Otter
